definition: to leave home/to go off/to run away

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to leave home (to live somewhere else)

sentences.english: Is there anything I can do to improve the situation rather than leave?
sentences.chinese: 除了离家出走，我还可以做些什么来改变现状吗？

sentences.english: Originally wanted to dissolve the heart of small read slowly, and, behold, the little read away from home.
sentences.chinese: 原本想化解小念心里的心结，不料，小念离家出走。

sentences.english: It seems that he went away in the small hours.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎是在后半夜出走的。

sentences.english: Pacheco's transfer continued a trend of teenagers leaving Barcelona for the Premier League.
sentences.chinese: 帕切科的转会沿袭了巴塞罗那青少年出走英超的传统。

sentences.english: Heathcliff overhears and runs away from Wuthering Heights. Ch 9
sentences.chinese: 希斯克里夫无意间听到，于是从呼啸山庄离家出走。

sentences.english: Should couples be forced to divorce when their children leave home?
sentences.chinese: 孩子离家出走了，夫妇就该被迫离婚啦？

sentences.english: I went out in the still of the night.
sentences.chinese: 我出走那是半夜三更一片寂静。

sentences.english: Then he upped and ran away from home.
Then he ran off and soon came to a great marsh where the wild ducks lived.
sentences.chinese: 于是他离家出走，不久就来到一片野鸭住的广阔沼泽。

sentences.english: BingYin son is afraid to stay and become a negative tired, leave a book.
sentences.chinese: 丙寅为怕留下来成为儿子负累，便留书出走。

sentences.english: Waaaaay out, in the water, see it swimming.
sentences.chinese: 出走了，在水里，看见它在游。

sentences.english: The man bunked off and left his wife with three children.
sentences.chinese: 那个男人已离家出走，丢下妻予和三个孩子。

sentences.english: Certain media call Lei Jun " mental cacique " leave.
sentences.chinese: 某些媒体称雷军为“精神领袖”出走。

sentences.english: Maybe she just went away in a fit of pique, when she is not angry,she will be back.
sentences.chinese: 或许她只是一时赌气出走，等她气消了自然会回来的。

sentences.english: Avoid flee, footprint in the great river north and south.
sentences.chinese: 避而出走，足迹遍及大江南北。

definition: to depart/to leave
to seek shelter/to seek asylum
to leave home (to live somewhere else)
to have a falling out/to have a big argument
to leave without saying good-bye
to leave/to exit
discouraged/downhearted
lit. to take different roads and urge the horses on (idiom)/fig. to part ways
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to form one's own group or school of thought/to set up one's own business/to establish oneself
to resign
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
to improve one's family's social status by moving up in the world/to switch one's allegiance to a new patron
to return to
to release/to set free/to allow (a person or an animal) to go/to liberate
to follow/to accompany
